instructions: Go to the SMS Backup+ page and download the app on your Android device. This is the usual method that you follow to install apps on your smartphone. Download-on-Google-Play On your PC go to Gmail.com and login your account. It will look something like this; of course you will see your own mails. 1 Once there click on the gear shaped icon on the top right corner of the screen. It will drop down a menu. Now you need to select the settings. 2 You will see the settings screen, simply click on the Forwarding and POP/IMAP tab on the top. How to Save SMS on Gmail and Keep Them Forever Now you simply have to enable the IMAP and save the settings. Don t worry this is will not compromise the security of your smartphone or your Emails. 4 Now back on your smartphone, open the app we just downloaded. It has a very simple and straightforward interface. Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-45-35 Click on the Login check-box to login to your Google account. The app will ask you something like this: Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-45-392-576x1024 After that the app will simply ask if you want to back up the existing SMS on the device. It is always wise to backup them. If you select yes, the app will start the backup process. Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-45-53 You can change some settings while the backup is being done. For example I changed the backup schedule. Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-46-09 While the SMS are being backed up, you can go to your PC or even the Gmail app. From there you can easily see the SMS label automatically made. 6 You can start browsing the SMS as they upload, the page will automatically refresh after a while, adding in new SMS dynamically.

Get the app from the Google Play Store. Download-on-Google-Play Launch the app. You will see a screen like this. From there, tap on the backup button to proceed. Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-53-56 Select a local folder for storage. Don t worry you will get to upload the SMS on the next step. It s always good to have a local backup anyways. Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-54-02 Once you press OK you will be taken to another option screen. Select the Upload to Email option. Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-54-18 The app will tell you that a plugin in needed for this function to work. Get the plugin from the Google Play Store, the app will take you to it directly. Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-54-46 After you have downloaded the plugin you can select the email service you want to utilize. Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-55-02 Now simply login to your account and start backing up SMS to Gmail with ease. Screenshot_2015-05-25-21-55-11
